result.execSummary:
The defendant Shontae M Martin Cole was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--To pay restitution of $1805, payable to Walmart Corporation, Jefferson

--To pay 10% restitution processing fee

--To pay statutory costs 

--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge

--To pay $64.49 summons fee
--Attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent

--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent

--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Court does not object to early discharge from probation as long as all conditions have been met including all financial obligations & restitution.

Court has no objection to transfer of probation as long as receiving State has no objection

Arresting Agency: Jefferson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

[ml] Case called at 9:41AM
[Court Reporter Edward Johnson]
Defendant Shontae M Martin Cole does not appear. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies Victim Rights Compliance.
ADA Teuber provides context as to why this hearing is scheduled for today.
The State requests that the Defendant be discharged from Probation when the current term ends later this month, and that a civil judgment be entered against the Defendant in the amount of $1,305.00.

The Court quashes the warrant, and orders that a civil judgment be entered in the amount of $1,305.00 against the Defendant and in favor of Walmart. 

recess 9:44AM

with elements

Case called at 3:37 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Shontae M Martin Cole in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--No Contact with co-actor Charissa Williams
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agents
--To pay statutory costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay restitution of $1805, payable to Walmart Corporation, Jefferson
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee
--To pay $64.49 summons fee
Court does not object to early discharge from probation as long as all conditions have been met including all financial obligations & restitution
Court has no objection to transfer of probation as long as receiving State has no objection

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 3:56 pm

ADDRESS INFO for Shontae M Martin Cole
Current: 543 Hackett St, Beloit, WI 53511 United States  (Effective: 06-24-2016)
Prior: 1125 1/2 Emerson St, Beloit, WI 53511 United States
Note from Court's JA * NOH for plea/sentencing remailed to address on bottom of returned envelope. Address updated on CCAP
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Case called at 2:04 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for PLEAS)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Shontae M Martin Cole in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel informs the Court that Miss Martin Cole has had second thoughts on plea agreement, requests the Court set matter for adjourned plea/sentencing date. Do believe that agreement can be reached.
ADA Beck informs the Court that the State would not object to short adjournment, but if the matter does not resolve at the next hearing, would request matter be set for trial
Court informs parties that it will set matter out one more time for plea/sentencing, but if it does not resolve, matter will be put on trial calendar. 
Court reminds Miss Martin Cole that her bond remains as fixed
Recess: 2:10 pm 

NEXT: Reschedule Plea/Sentencing 7/8/16 at 3:30 pm - Send notices **JA please note that if case doesn't settle, should be set for trial**
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

[MK] case called at 2:08pm. 
Defendant Shontae M Martin Cole in court with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rhiel indicates that Ms. Martin Cole is accepting a plea-offer tendered by the State, however the Defense is requesting scheduling of a plea and sentencing in approximately one month because of Ms. Martin Cole's imminent childbirth planned within the next two days. 
The Court adjourns. 
The Court continues the Bond. 
recess 2:10pm. 

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing on 6/17/16 at 2:00pm. -- send notices
Status conference on May 9, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Case called at 1:37 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Mac J. Davis presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Shontae M Martin Cole in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel requests the Court set the matter over for additional STC in 2-3 weeks, believe case will resolve but do have a few items to discuss yet
ADA Beck informs the Court that the State has no objection to adjournment
Atty Rhiel informs the Court that Miss Cole's due date is May 16th and that her pregnancy is high risk, requests date prior or late after the 16th.
Recess: 1:39 pm

NEXT: Schedule STC 5/9/16 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
Status conference at 04-11-2016 01:30 pm
Pre-trial conference at 02-24-2016 10:20 am

Court reminds Defendant that bond and conditions of bond remain in effect as case is pending.
